div.p:
The first of these two tractates on a single plate offers an
anti-classical perspective on morality and concepts of unity in the
arts. The second tractate denounces ancient Greece and Rome as
tyrannies promoting war and dominion and destroying the imaginative
arts. Blake etched in relief and printed all copies (A-F) c.
1822.
